SENT.plain: Two patients with malignant brain tumors who developed acute nonlymphocytic leukemia after treatment with radiation and chemotherapy are described
Both patients survived more than 2 years after diagnosis of the brain tumor
Survival following the diagnosis of leukemia was short, and both patients died of hemorrhage secondary to thrombocytopenia
A review of the literature reveals that leukemia after combined-modality treatment of malignant brain tumors is rare

A prolonged survival period from diagnosis of the primary tumor, treatment with nitrosoureas and radiation, plus the development of a preleukemic myelodysplastic syndrome are all important features of therapy-related nonlymphocytic leukemia
